page.title: 03QUEEN VICTORIA SCHOOL(RECN)
page.content: The school has a very good Pipe Band. It has played at Rugby Internationals at Murrayfield without fail since inception on 21st march 1925. The band also plays at several other functions throughout the year. Highland dancers also give a good account of themselves in various displays and competitions. The main sports are rugby, football, athletics, sailing, canoeing, and swimming. Many hobbies are available to the boys during the long winter term. The main event of the year is Grand Day when the boys dress up in their red jackets and Hunting Stewart kilts and parade before their parents and an inspecting general.
